item.title: Sea of Thieves: Complete Fishing Guide
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Fish in Sea of Thieves
  • Where to Get Bait in Sea of Thieves
  • Fish Types & Locations in Sea of Thieves
  • How to Cook Fish in Sea of Thieves

Fishing is one of many different things you can do in Sea of Thieves , and it offers a different pace of life in Rare's pirate sandbox. Once you learn the ropes of fishing, it also becomes another way to make money in Sea of Thieves and increase your Hunter’s Call Reputation, with some species of fish being particularly lucrative. However, learning how to fish in Sea of Thieves can take time, with there being numerous species and varieties to find and catch.

If you’re a fishing newcomer, this complete Sea of Thieves fishing guide will provide beginners with a rundown on what they need to know about how to get started, including where to find bait and how to cook fish. Fishing veterans may also appreciate having access to a handy reference for all fish types and locations.

How to Fish in Sea of Thieves

If you're new to fishing in Sea of Thieves , the first step in getting accustomed to things will involve learning how to fish , which can feel a bit tricky to begin with. There are several steps to successfully catching fish in Sea of Thieves , which are as follows:

  • To begin fishing, select your fishing rod from the second page of the radial equipment wheel . Provided you have bait in your inventory, you can add bait to your fishing rod if needed by pressing the B button (if playing on Xbox) to select and attach your chosen bait.
  • Press the right trigger to cast your line into the water and wait for a fish to appear and bite it, with its on-screen text displaying what type of fish it is. Hold and release the right trigger to cast your line further or press the left trigger to cancel fishing if you want to try catching something else.
  • As soon as the fish grabs the line, it typically shoots off towards the horizon , so be prepared to tilt the angle of your fishing forward using the right stick to prevent the line from stuttering and snapping. The fish will also swap between swimming left or right to get away. Typically, you need to tilt your fishing rod in the opposite direction the fish is swimming in to prevent the line from snapping and allowing the fish to escape. Angle your fishing rod to the right when the fish swims to the left and vice versa.
  • When the fish briefly tires and stops moving , hold the right trigger to reel it in . Repeat step three until you can fully reel the fish in and grab it from your fishing rod. The video below shows the above steps in action, demonstrating how to catch an Indigo Splashtail in Sea of Thieves without bait:

Of course, to catch certain types of fish in Sea of Thieves, you must add bait to your fishing rod before casting your line to get rarer and more valuable varieties. However, you don't always need bait to catch fish in Sea of Thieves , and for other fishing finds like Treacherous Plunder , it's not necessary.

Where to Get Bait in Sea of Thieves

Currently, there are three types of bait in Sea of Thieves :

  • Earthworms
  • Grubs
  • Leeches

There are several places to get bait in Sea of Thieves . At any outpost, you can buy a Bait Crate from the Merchant's Alliance Trading Company Representative using 5,000 gold for 50 Earthworms , 50 Leeches , and 50 Grubs . However, sailing on a captained ship, you can also buy a Bait Supply from the Shipwright Shop for 3,500 gold , sending 10 of each bait type to the food barrel on your ship. You can get bait in Sea of Thieves by:

  • Buying a Bait Crate from the Hunter's Call Company Shop at any Seapost for 5,000 gold (x50 of each bait type) .
  • Digging up bait on any island using your shovel for a chance to grab any bait type from the ground.
  • Randomly finding Bait Crates in the open world, which might not be full.

Fish Types & Locations in Sea of Thieves

Once caught, it's best to sell fish to the Hunter's Call Trading Company at any Seapost for maximum profits. There are 10 core types of fish in Sea of Thieves , but each has five varieties with different chances of appearing, such as those only caught at night. However, all fish and their sub-varieties also have Trophy variants - large versions of the regular fish that are typically harder to grab.

Therefore, it helps to know where to find the best fishing spots in Sea of Thieves , especially as some are only found in certain map regions or under particular conditions. The 10 fish types, their varieties, locations, and catching requirements are detailed below:

  • Splashtails (Ruby, Sunny, Indigo, Umber, and Seaform night variant) - located in open water in any region without bait , except for ponds.
  • Pondies (Charcoal, Orchid, Bronze, Bright, and Moonsky night variant) - a freshwater fish found in ponds without bait .
  • Islehoppers (Stone, Moss, Honey, Raven, and Amythyst) - located in the water surrounding specific large islands without bait , except for Raven Islehoppers, which can be found near any large island.
  • Wildsplashes (Russet, Sandy, Ocean, Muddy, and Coral night variant) - found in open water in The Wilds map region using Earthworms as bait.
  • Devilfishes (Ashen, Seashell, Lava, Forsaken, and Firelight night variant) - found in open water in The Devil's Roar map region using Grubs .
  • Ancientscales (Almond, Sapphire, Smoke, Bone, and Starshine night variant) - found in open water in the Ancient Isles map region using Leeches .
  • Plentifins (Olive, Amber, Cloudy, Bonedust, and Watery night variant) - found in open water in The Shores of Plenty map region using Earthworms .
  • Battlegills (Jade, Sky, Rum, Sand, and Bittersweet night variant) - found in water near Skeleton Ships or active Forts of the Damned , Fort of Fortune , or Skeleton Forts using Grubs as bait.
  • Stormfishes (Ancient, Shores, Wild, Shadow, and Twilight night variant) - found in open water inside heavy storms using Leeches as bait, with some located regionally : Ancient Stormfish (Ancient Isles) , Shores Stormfish (The Shores of Plenty) , and Wild Stormfish (The Wilds) .
  • Wreckers (Rose, Sun, Blackcloud, Snow, and Moon night variant) - found near shipwrecks or shipwrecks in storms in the case of the Blackcloud variant and by using Earthworms as bait.

How to Cook Fish in Sea of Thieves

Cooking fish to perfection in Sea of Thieves is all about timing and is beneficial, as correctly cooked fish gets you more money. The time it takes to cook fish depends on their size, with small fish like Indigo Splashtails taking as little as around 35 seconds to large Trophy Fish taking at least one minute .

As a general rule, you should cook fish until they turn a light to warm brown shade . Any longer, and the fish gradually burns, reducing its value when sold to the Hunter's Call and becoming a fire hazard. You can cook fish using the stove on your ship , campfires , or quadruple pans at a Sea Fort .

Cooking food like fish in Sea of Thieves is also a great way to top up your pirate's health more efficiently . However, you can’t sell half-eaten fish to the Hunter's Call, so be careful what you eat.

item.title: 8 Best RPGs That Focus On Boss Fights
item.description:
Summary

  • Epic boss battles in RPGs push players to their limits, requiring strategic thinking and preparation.
  • Games like Monster Hunter, Dark Souls, and Elden Ring offer engaging boss fights integral to gameplay success.
  • Boss fights in titles like God of War and Dragon's Dogma 2 provide a cinematic and challenging experience for players.

Boss battles are all the rage in most video games, with players loving the idea of taking on tough opponents in epic battles where a single mistake can be the difference between victory and defeat. Some of the best RPGs know how important this part of the game is, integrating a host of challenging fights that push players to their very limits.

Players who enjoy the spectacle of games with incredible cinematic combat will love taking on well-designed bosses who can be a nightmare to deal with. Leveling up characters and making sure they're prepared to deal with a challenging threat is important for players who are struggling against a particularly grueling boss in an RPG.

8 Monster Hunter: World

Completing Hunts And Taking Out Massive Monsters Is A Blast

Every Monster Hunter game uses its larger-than-life boss fights to keep fans engaged, and World is no exception here. Players will love taking on several missions where they fight powerful monsters with their friends and attain victory after a lengthy battle.

Beating these powerful foes and using the loot to acquire more powerful gear is the central gameplay loop that fans will get adjusted to in no time. Eventually, the monsters become more challenging than ever, forcing players to be tactical in their approach and ensure that their group is ready to tackle the next hunt.

7 Dark Souls

The Boss Fights Are The Bread-And-Butter Of This Legendary Action RPG

Dark Souls is one of the best video games ever made, ushering in a new era of action RPGs and coining the name for a whole new genre. Players loved the amazing level design, challenging combat, and incredible worldbuilding present in a game that became all the rage after its launch.

Of course, it'd be impossible to talk about the best parts of Dark Souls without mentioning its amazing boss fights. Players must brace themselves every time they cross a fog gate to try to defeat a boss who defeated them handily last time. These battles are as engaging as they come and force players to utilize everything they've learned in the game to come out victorious against these foes and enjoy a sense of achievement.

6 God Of War Ragnarok

The Amazing Boss Fights In This Title Are A Joy To Play Through

God of War 's 2018 reboot was a much-celebrated return to form for Kratos, even if some people felt that the enemy variety was somewhat lacking. Facing different reskins of a troll over and over again became rather grating for players who wanted to enjoy some cinematic combat.

Ragnarok addressed this criticism by making each boss more meaningful than ever before. Players had to strategize for each encounter and utilize their high-damage skills to help Kratos win in these epic encounters that are as cinematic as they come.

5 Bloodborne

The Fast-Paced Combat And Challenging Bosses Make This FromSoftware's Best Game In The Eyes Of Many

After his much-celebrated work on Dark Souls , Miyakazi decided to implement aspects of gothic and Lovecraftian horror in its titles. The result was a smashing success, with Bloodborne being hailed by many as one of the best FromSoftware video games of all time.

The fast-paced combat system lets the developer integrate the hardest bosses they've ever developed for a FromSoftware game. The DLC takes things a step further, with fights like Ludwig and the Orphan of Kos being devilishly hard and forcing players to stay on the offensive without taking too much damage, which is easier said than done.

4 Dragon's Dogma 2

Climbing On Massive Bosses And Wailing On Them Is A Ton Of Fun

Most fans wanted a Dragon's Dogma sequel to deliver more of the action-packed combat system they'd grown to love, and this game didn't disappoint. While the lack of innovations was highlighted by some players, most people loved how engaging the combat could be, especially when they faced a boss.

From random area bosses to story encounters, the game is rife with these boss encounters that push players to their very limit. Making the most of their chosen vocation and climbing onto monsters to hit their weak spots makes for some intense battles as Dragon's Dogma 2 shines in these cinematic encounters.

3 Elden Ring

Repetitive Encounters Aside, The Game's Litany Of Bosses Are A Joy To Fight Against

Elden Ring is FromSoftware's most popular video game by a country mile. The open world is a joy to explore as players get stronger at their own pace, eventually letting them tackle and defeat bosses who were giving them a rough time early on.

While the game suffers from repeating certain bosses in other sections of the open world, most fans consider this to be a minor issue in the grand scheme of things. For the most part, everything from fast-paced duels to epic dragon fights can be enjoyed in Elden Ring , with the variety of these boss encounters coupled with their challenge justifying all the accolades this game enjoyed when it launched.

2 Lies Of P

The Game's Challenging Combat Must Be Mastered For Some Lengthy Multi-Phase Boss Fights

Players expecting Lies of P to be another run-of-the-mill Soulslike were floored by the game's impressive visuals, challenging combat, tantalizing story, and a suite of impressive boss fights. Players needed to be at the very top of their game if they didn't want to be surprised by the sheer speed and ferociousness of these battles.

Most of the bosses in Lies of P have multiple phases, a trope executed so many times that it becomes somewhat tiring as the game goes on. However, this is a minor complaint in the grand scheme of things, with players loving how challenging and rewarding these boss fights are otherwise.

1 Final Fantasy 16

The Spectacle Of This Title's Boss Fights Is Over-The-Top In The Best Way Possible

Final Fantasy 16 may be ridiculously easy at times, but that should take nothing away from the awe-inspiring nature of the game's bosses. From high-pressure hunts to storyline encounters against other Eikons, it's easy to see why Clive's bombastic battles leave a lasting impression on many players.

Some of the battles may be all style and no substance, but Final Fantasy 16 thankfully ramps up the challenge in later boss fights to make every victory taste sweeter. Battles against Odin and Ultima are especially notable for upping the stakes, making it entirely possible for players to be defeated in battle after steamrolling through the majority of the game's encounters.

item.title: CoD Black Ops 6 & Warzone: How to Get The Terminator Operator
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Get The Terminator Operator Skins in BO6 & Warzone
  • All The Terminator Bundle Content in Black Ops 6 & Warzone

Call of Duty has featured an impressive range of crossovers, introducing players to iconic characters from TV, movies, and even other video games. With Season 2 of Black Ops 6 and Warzone , this tradition continues as Arnold Schwarzenegger’s legendary character, The Terminator , makes a comeback.

The Terminator previously appeared in Call of Duty: Vanguard , offering skins for both Schwarzenegger’s T-800 model and Robert Patrick’s T-1000 counterpart. If you’re excited to unlock these Operator skins in BO6 and Warzone , here’s everything you need to know about acquiring The Terminator in the latest season.

How to Get The Terminator Operator Skins in BO6 & Warzone

To unlock The Terminator Operator skins in Black Ops 6 and Warzone , players must purchase the Tracer Pack: The Terminator bundle from the in-game store upon its release during Season 2.

The bundle features two Ultra Skins inspired by the classic 1984 film. These include the humanlike appearance of the T-800 model and its recognizable cyborg counterpart, allowing players to channel the menacing essence of this legendary character during gameplay.

Cosmetic themes are designed to align seamlessly with the franchise’s signature aesthetic, allowing fans to immerse themselves further in the iconic lore. Once The Terminator store pack becomes available in the in-game store during Season 2, we’ll update this guide with a detailed showcase, including pricing and availability. Be sure to bookmark this page for the latest information.

All The Terminator Bundle Content in Black Ops 6 & Warzone

Here's everything included in The Terminator store bundle in Black Ops 6 and Warzone:

  • The Terminator – Operator
  • T-800 – Operator Skin
  • Titanium Core – Operator Skin
  • Four Red Tracer-equipped – Weapon Blueprints
  • T-800 Style – Finishing Move
  • Tracking...Tracking... – Emote
  • What Pain? – Emblem
  • Lookin’ Fly – Calling Card

Much like Vanguard’s 2022 offering, Black Ops 6 and Warzone ’s The Terminator Tracker Pack introduces two Ultra skins based on iconic franchise characters that will feature in-game reactive effects. These skins allow players to embody the legendary killing machine from James Cameron’s film. The bundle’s release will be accompanied by a themed event, offering players 13 unique rewards, including special attachments and blueprints. This event will challenge players to earn skulls by securing kills in Multiplayer and Zombies, as well as eliminating enemies and opening loot caches in Warzone .

To further immerse players in The Terminator universe, the event will grant bonus skulls for using explosive or fire damage ammunition, reflecting the iconic character’s destructive style from the films. This added layer of Terminator -inspired content enhances the overall experience, making it a memorable and engaging event for fans of both franchises.

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail - Enlightenments and Fragments of Recollection Locations in Janusopolis
item.description:
Quick Links

  • "Abyss of Fate" Janusopolis Enlightenment Locations in Honkai: Star Rail
  • "Abyss of Fate" Janusopolis Fragments of Recollection Locations in Honkai: Star Rail

"Abyss of Fate" Janusopolis is the smallest new area at Amphoreus in Honkai: Star Rail . However, this place still provides an excellent experience of exploring, featuring several 3D rooms that require puzzles to be solved before players can get everything the place has to offer.

However, treasure chests are not the only thing Trailblazers can get in this area. There are also two hidden achievements that can only be obtained by interacting with Enlightenments and Fragments of Recollection. Like any other achievements in the game, these two will also reward players with Stellar Jades upon completion. For those looking to unlock said achievements, here's how to get Enlightenments and Fragments of Recollection at Janusopolis in Honkai: Star Rail .

"Abyss of Fate" Janusopolis Enlightenment Locations in Honkai: Star Rail

Trailblazers can find 4 Enlightenments at "Abyss of Fate" Janusopolis in Honkai: Star Rail . Janusopolis is the earliest area to be unlocked after starting the Trailblaze Mission in Amphoreus, so most players should've unlocked this area by now. One of the Enlightenment is inside a complex 3D room, but the scroll is right by the entrance, so players don't have to worry about solving any puzzles.

  1. Start by teleporting to Destiny's Desolation Space Anchor in Janusopolis and walk forward until players reach the 3D room. Once inside, head to the left side and go to the second level using the stairs. The Oronyx's Statue Enlightenment can be seen at the end of the road.
  2. Next, use the Silent Shroud Space Anchor right outside the 3D room and head west to the edge of the road for the Worldbearing Titan Enlightenment.
  3. From the previous position, walk back to the space anchor, and this time, walk to the north near the Janus' Hidden Passage for another Enlightenment called Gate of Infinity.
  4. Now, use the Janus' Hidden Passage to reach the other side of the building or simply use the Everdream Gate Space Anchor . Head inside the 3D room on the north and Trailblazers can see a Talanton's Scale Enlightenment in the middle of the room near the entrance.

By interacting with all 4 Enlightenments at "Abyss of Fate" Janusopolis in Honkai: Star Rail , Trailblazers will get the 'I Call Upon Night of Old' achievemen.

"Abyss of Fate" Janusopolis Fragments of Recollection Locations in Honkai: Star Rail

There is only 1 Fragment of Recollection at "Abyss of Fate" Janusopolis in Honkai: Star Rail . Trailblazers can teleport to Dreamshroud Mausoleum Space Anchor and walk forward to the purple crystal at the side of the room. The afterimages from the Fragment of Recollection feature a Holy Maiden and Stonemason, where the lady is requesting a volcanic glass. The discussion changes topic to the unrest in politics inside the city, and the Stonemason also advises the maiden to run away if push comes to shove, as the officials in the city do not treat her well.

After listening to the past within the Fragments of Recollection in this location, players will unlock the hidden 'Holy Deer's Death' achievement. In addition, if this is the first time that Trailblazers have reached the Dreamshroud Mausoleum in "Abyss of Fate" Janusopolis after completing the whole Trailblaze Mission, they will also get the 'Dawn of the Living Dead' achievement.

Make sure to claim the Stellar Jade rewards from the Achievements page that can be accessed from the main menu.

item.title: Elden Ring: Hardest Bosses In Shadow Of The Erdtree, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Elden Ring's Shadow of the Erdtree DLC features challenging bosses and new consumables.
  • Golden Hippopotamus, Romina, Saint of the Bud, and Promised Consort Radahn are among the hardest bosses in Shadow of the Erdtree.
  • Bosses like Divine Beast Dancing Lion, Putrescent Knight, and Messmer, The Impaler have access to unique attacks provide incredibly difficult battles.

Elden Ring 's Shadow of the Erdtree DLC is full of surprises, new consumables, and a large arsenal of weapons for players to take advantage of while exploring the Land of Shadow. There's no denying that the difficulty was turned up to 11 in comparison to the base game, and that's saying a lot, as it was not easy to begin with.

Many bosses in the DLC (if not all) are arguably harder than any base game boss players have faced previously, making many gamers look like pushovers swinging rose petals instead of blades. That said, even among the hardest enemies in the Land of Shadow, some stand out above others. The hardest bosses in Shadow of the Erdtree are sure to give even veteran Elden Ring players a run for their money.

Updated on January 22, 2025, by Gerardo Molina : FromSoftware games have always been famous for challenging players’ patience and determination, as the bosses are often formidable and require multiple runs to defeat. While the base game already pitted players against insurmountable odds, the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC kicked things up a notch and humbled many people who though they were overpowered in The Lands Between. While not all the bosses on this list are mandatory to progress through the DLC, it's recommended that players don't skip any of them, as they yield handsome rewards and are quite interesting to fight. Even if sometimes the process to defeat them can be frustrating.

11 Golden Hippopotamus

Gaping Jaws Combined With Deadly Speed

Location

Shadow Keep

Drops

200,000 Runes, Aspects of the Crucible: Thorns , 2 Scadutree Fragments

HP

33,866

Starting off strong, the Golden Hippopotamus is one of the hardest bosses in S hadow of the Erdtree . Sometimes, a difficult boss' first phase is simple enough, letting players catch a breath before facing the actual challenge. However, this is sadly not the case for this boss. Right out of the gate, the Golden Hippopotamus attacks the Tarnished swiftly, with gaping jaws that are reminiscent of Sulyvahn's Beast from Dark Souls 3 .

10 Romina, Saint Of The Bud

Uses Unpredictable Rolling Attacks

Location

Church of the Bud

Drops

380,000 Runes, Remembrance of the Saint of the Bud

HP

35,798

Romina, Saint of the Bud is creepy-looking, but that's not why she's considered to be one of the hardest bosses in S hadow of the Erdtree . What gives her this title is her massive size, combat moveset, and ridiculously long blade reach. Romina also has unpredictable rolling attacks that are very hard to dodge, and she can jump all over the arena in a matter of seconds.

Romina could easily pass as Dark Souls 1 's Chaos Witch Quelaag's sister, as her design also combines humanoid features with insect body parts that she can use to damage the Tarnished. This boss is not optional, but when defeated, she will yield a considerable number of Runes.

9 Divine Beast Dancing Lion

Has Access To Lethal Lightning AoE Attacks

Location

Belurat, Tower Settlement

Drops

90,000 Runes, Remembrance of the Dancing Lion , Divine Beast Head , Divine Beast Tornado

HP

22,571

Continuing with the list of creepy-looking bosses, the Divine Beast Dancing Lion should not be underestimated. With a body that appears to combine a lion's head with humanoid limbs, this beast wastes no time and immediately attacks the Tarnished with merciless blows that can drop even the chunkiest Health bar to 0 in a matter of seconds.

Once phase 2 begins, this boss will increase its speed and dance around the area, traversing from side to side at inhuman speed. During said phase, the Divine Beast Dancing Lion can also use powerful Lightning AoE attacks that are very hard to dodge properly and can sometimes stun players' characters, leaving them vulnerable to being hit. Luckily, this boss is optional, and considering that it doesn't drop that many Runes upon defeat, players not looking for an extra challenge can easily avoid it without feeling guilty.

8 Metyr, Mother Of Fingers

An Optional Boss That Should Not Be Skipped

Location

Finger Ruins of Miyr

Drops

420,000 Runes, Remembrance of the Mother of Fingers

HP

43,296

Metyr, Mother of Fingers is one of the most odd-looking bosses in both the base Elden Ring game and the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC. This boss's entire body is made of fingers, which fits its name quite well. Metyr also plays a very important part in the game’s lore and is overall quite interesting.

While not the strongest boss in the DLC, Metyr poses a formidable challenge, and players will likely have to face her more than once to emerge victorious. She has a certain weakness to Slash damage and yields the Remembrance of the Mother of Fingers, which can either be exchanged at the Roundtable Hold for an additional 40,000 Runes, or the Staff of the Great Beyond .

7 Rellana, Twin Moon Knight

Makes Use Of Relentless Attacks & Deadly Spells

Location

Castle Ensis

Drops

240,000 Runes, Remembrance of the Twin Moon Knight

HP

29,723

Rellana is arguably the hardest early-game skill check in any Soulsborne title. Players entering Shadow of the Erdtree are recommended to be at least at level 150 before beginning their DLC journey. And while that might seem like a lot, they'll still struggle considerably, as this boss will greet them with unmatched strength, lethal moon projectiles, and relentless attacks.

Rellana's first phase isn't too bad (compared to the second one), as she won't use as many attacks that deal Elemental Damage. However, once her Health bar is depleted to a certain extent, both of her blades become extremely dangerous, and so do her magical attacks. Although the game's most recent patch has made this fight a bit more fair by ramping up Scadutree attributes early on, most players will still find Rellana very challenging.

6 Midra, Lord of Frenzied Flame

A Powerful Boss With A Deceiving Appearance

Location

Midra's Manse

Drops

410,000 Runes, Remembrance of the Lord of Frenzied Flame

HP

47,171

When players first encounter Midra, Lord of the Frenzied Flame , he doesn't look like much, just another helpless NPC consumed by the Frenzied Flame. However, when players strike his initial form down, an incredibly epic cutscene begins, foreshadowing the power of the boss players are about to face.

Midra isn't particularly difficult during its first phase, as he mainly uses sword attacks that, while having a decent range, can be easily dodged once players learn his moveset and attack rhythm. The real challenge begins when half his Health bar has been depleted, as he will start to use many more AoE attacks and even spawn spikes from the ground, which cover a few meters around him. And to make matters worse, Midra has a rather large Health pool that comes close to that of Promised Consort Radahn, making him very resilient.

Luckily, he has a relatively low stance Stat, meaning that he can be stance-broken with a few heavy attacks from a Colossal weapon or something of the sort.

5 Scadutree Avatar

The Ultimate Guardian Of Miquella's Great Rune

Location

Scadutree Base

Drops

260,000 Runes, Remembrance of the Shadow Sunflower , Miquella's Great Rune

HP

34,776

The Scadutree Avatar is probably one of the most aggressive bosses in the DLC, as it often chains several different attacks together that can chase players throughout the battle arena. One of the most infamous attacks this boss has, includes underground thorns that advance towards players and rise at the right moment to inflict considerable damage.

With three different phases, each more challenging and aggressive than the last, the Scadutree Avatar poses a significant challenge to players, even those who have already beaten other bosses in the DLC. While it doesn't yield as many Runes as Midra or Messmer, defeating it does reward players with Miquella's Great Rune. This Rune comes in very handy during the fight against Promised Consort Radahn, as it removes the insta-kill debuff applied by Miquella, thus increasing players' chances of success.

4 Putrescent Knight

Hellish Flames With Wide Coverage

Location

Stone Coffin Fissure

Drops

220,000 Runes, Remembrance of the Putrescence

HP

20,000

The Putrescent Knight is a knight and horse combo found in the Fissure Depths within the Land of Shadow. It's recommended that players collect as many Scadutree fragments as possible before facing this spectral enemy, as it can deal considerable amounts of damage and has a blue flame AoE that can cover extremely wide areas.

Like the Divine Beast Dancing Lion, the Putrescent Knight is an optional boss, so players won't have to defeat it to progress through the DLC. However, upon death, this boss drops a nice 220,000 Runes, and the Remembrance of Putrescence, which can be exchanged for the Putrescence Cleaver . When fighting the Putrescent Knight, players should be wary of its semicircular sword, as it can be very unpredictable and hard to dodge.

3 Bayle The Dread

The Sworn Enemy Of The Ancient Dragons

Location

Jagged Peak

Drops

490,000 Runes, Heart of Bayle

HP

41,612

The base game has tons of interesting and powerful dragons for players to face and defeat. However, they all pale in comparison to the mighty Bayle the Dread from the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC. This formidable enemy is weak to Piercing damage, but resistant to all other elements, so players planning to use any kind of elemental buffs are out of luck.

Once Bayle is killed, players can collect the Heart of Bayle, which can be used at the Grand Altar of Dragon Communion to trade for Bayle’s Flame Lightning or Bayle’s Tyranny.

2 Messmer, The Impaler

Has Access To Vicious & Long-Range Thrusting Attacks

Location

Shadow Keep, Specimen Storehouse

Drops

400,000 Runes, Remembrance of the Impaler , Messmer's Kindling

HP

38,981

Messmer the Impaler might not look like much when players first encounter him within the Specimen Storehouse in the Shadow Keep. However, as Soulsborne games have taught several people over the years, humanoid enemies are a coin toss, as they can either be pushovers or absolute menaces. And sadly, Messmer is the latter.

With its quick moveset, long range weapon thrusts, temporary serpent form, and devastating Elemental Damage attacks, Messmer is clearly one of the hardest bosses in Shadow of the Erdtree . This demigod is not optional, and it's recommended that players consume as many Scadutree fragments as possible before facing him. Luckily, defeating Messmer will yield a reward of 400,000 Runes, as well as the Remembrance of the Impaler. So, in a way, the effort will be well worth it.

1 Promised Consort Radahn

Provides Endless Meteorite Showers

Location

Enir-Ilim

Drops

500,000 Runes, Remembrance of a God and a Lord

HP

46,134

While not always a rule, the final boss in any game or DLC should be the hardest of all, and luckily, this is the case for Shadow of the Erdtree and Promised Consort Radahn . While every player who's reached the Land of Shadow has already defeated Starscourge Radahn, it's important to remember that that instance of the demigod is well past his prime. The Radahn encountered in the dreaded Caelid area has grown mad and weak due to Scarlet Rot, whereas Promised Consort Radahn is an apex predator.

With an extremely aggressive moveset that leaves no room for error and few attack windows, this boss delivers a satisfying and sometimes frustrating final challenge. Promised Consort Radahn uses his twin blades for melee combat but also takes advantage of his gravity control powers to fling meteorites at the Tarnished. And if that wasn't enough, once the second phase starts and Miquella joins Radahn, players will also have to worry about deadly rays of light pouring from the sky.
